House Bill/Resolution NO. HB07829
FULL TITLE : AN ACT DEFINING THE CRIME OF BETRAYAL OF DUTY IN THE CUSTODY OF PRISONERS PROVIDING FOR ADDITIONAL RULES ON THE IMPRISONMENT, DETENTION, CONFINEMENT AND CUSTODY OF PRISONERS AND DETAINEES, SPECIFYING ADDITIONAL WORK AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF GOVERNMENT PERSONNEL CHARGED WITH THE CUSTODY OF SUCH PRISONERS AND STATING THE PENALTIES THEREFORE, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
ABSTRACT : Imposes the penalty of life imprisonment without any provision for parole for the person or persons charged with the custody of prisoners who shall allow the escape of such prisoners who are accused of the commission of heinous, terrorism, war crimes and economic sabotage.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : ALEJANO, GARY C.
DATE FILED : 2018-05-31
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON JUSTICE ON 2018-07-30
